Runs quickly and skillfully evades pursuers by using the environment (river, tunnel, shadows) to lose them.
Trips and injures himself, showing a momentary lapse in physical control or awareness.
Expresses reluctance to kill and questions the plan despite pressure, showing moral hesitation but also a lack of readiness for the mission's demands.
Engages in a tense but clear dialogue with Flack, showing awareness of the stakes (bomb timer) and questioning the approach, indicating some critical thinking.
Reluctantly agrees to lead enemy fire to save Kim, showing concern for others.
Mocks enemy Rice by shouting and waving hands to distract him, risking his own safety.
Considers the risky plan reluctantly but agrees to execute it.
Hides quietly in the tunnel, watches carefully for threats, and notices the rat and surroundings.
Distracts Rice by shouting and mocking him, successfully drawing enemy fire away from others.
Shoots to protect by killing Opbst, then shows shock and reluctance about the killing, expressing he doesn't want to play anymore.
Hesitates to pick up the gun and kill again despite pressure from Flack.
Zigzags around Opbst at the last moment, avoiding being shot and continuing down the path.
Emerges from shadows and stares down at the dead Opbst, showing presence of mind after a tense moment.
Expresses shock and hesitation about continuing the dangerous game, showing emotional conflict and uncertainty.
Hesitates between picking up the gun and fleeing from the approaching killer, indicating indecision under pressure.
Suddenly whirls and runs away without breaking stride, escaping a dangerous situation.
Raises a gun to defend himself when cornered, warns opponent to stay away.
Runs into a dead end and gets trapped with nowhere to run, showing lack of situational awareness.
Raises a gun and warns the approaching enemy to stay away, attempting to defend himself despite being cornered.
Hesitates to shoot Rice despite being threatened and urged to do so.
Pleading for Rice to stop instead of retaliating with violence.
Mesmerized by the evil in Rice's tone, unable to act or shoot despite being ordered to do so.
Holds the Luger up and points it at Rice's face, showing some presence of mind under extreme pressure.
Screams in horror at the death of his friend Flack, showing emotional response and concern.
Shoots Rice to avenge Flack's death, acting decisively to protect and respond to harm done to a friend.
Calls out for Jack after Flack is shot, showing care and concern for his friends' wellbeing.
Raises his weapon quickly and shoots Rice between the eyes, killing him decisively.
Shows hesitation and horror at seeing his friend Flack seemingly killed.
Runs over to check on Flack immediately after shooting Rice.
Initially believes Flack is dead, showing a moment of disbelief when Flack reappears unharmed.
Throws and stomps on the lead figure of Jack Flack, expressing anger and frustration.
Refuses to continue playing, showing emotional honesty about his feelings.
Notices bullet holes in his hat and realizes it doesn't stop real bullets.
Expresses frustration and accuses Flack of tricking him into killing Rice.
Throws the lead figure at Flack impulsively and then stomps on it, damaging it.
Decides he doesn't want to play anymore, ending the game abruptly.
Gently cradles Flack's head as he falls, shows concern and panic at his condition.
Refuses to accept Flack's fading condition, insists it isn't over and promises to get help.
Notices Flack is bleeding and expresses concern, tries to reassure him, and attempts to get help despite the dire situation.
Shows panic and emotional distress when Flack is dying, pleading for him not to leave.
Calls out to his dying friend Jack Flack, expressing desperation and a plea for help.
Stops crying and wipes tears away, showing emotional vulnerability and sincerity.
Hobbles hurriedly down the path despite a wounded leg, showing determination but no direct interaction with others in this excerpt.
Looks around wildly and calls out for Jack Flack after he disappears, showing emotional distress and confusion.
Hobbles hurriedly down the path, dragging his wounded leg, moving as fast as he can toward the nearest exit despite injury.
Hobbles quickly to catch a bus to the airport despite physical difficulty.
Appeals sincerely and desperately to the bus driver to let him ride despite losing his pass and not having money.
Hesitates but decides to lie to the cab driver about having money in order to get a ride to the airport.
Loses his school bus pass and fails to pay the fare, resulting in being forced off the bus.
Attempts to negotiate with the bus driver to pay later, showing some resourcefulness but ultimately unsuccessful.
Decides to lie about having money to get a cab, indicating quick thinking under pressure but also moral hesitation.
Persists in asking multiple cab drivers for a ride despite initial rejection, demonstrating determination and problem-solving.
Pleading sincerely with the Hippie cab driver to take him to the airport despite his wounded leg, showing vulnerability and urgency.
Tearing up and showing emotional distress while explaining the urgency to save a girls life.
Persists in convincing a skeptical cab driver to help despite his injury and lack of immediate payment, emphasizing urgency and stakes.
Refuses medical help for his leg injury, prioritizing his mission over personal safety.
Presses the cab driver to go faster to meet a tight deadline, showing urgency and awareness of time constraints.
Relies on others (Kim) to communicate critical information but does not directly intervene at the security checkpoint, indicating possible over-reliance or lack of direct action.
Promises to help the Hippie get his money despite the Hippie's refusal.
Rushes into the terminal and urgently looks for Kim, showing concern and care.
Rushes into the terminal despite his bad leg, urgently searching for Kim and trying to find her quickly.
Pauses with his hand on the door, hesitating momentarily before acting.
Locates Flight to Mexico City quickly on the computer screen and notes boarding status and time left before bomb goes off.
Looks up and down the terminal searching desperately for Kim but does not take further action to find or contact her.
Frantically tries to stop the MacCreadys from leaving, showing concern for the girl and desperation to help.
Wails at the MacCreadys like a long lost child, showing emotional vulnerability and sincerity.
Attempts to stop the MacCreadys by alerting the guards and pointing them out, showing quick recognition of a threat.
Tries to bypass security protocol by dashing around the X-ray machine, resulting in being caught by a guard.
Fails to anticipate or effectively handle the delay caused by security procedures, allowing the MacCreadys to escape.
Shows persistence and emotional intensity by wailing and calling out to the MacCreadys, but this does not translate into effective action.
Innocently insists the MacCreadys are his parents despite their denial, tries to prove it sincerely by pointing to the game tape in the bag.
Calmly and confidently provides specific proof (pointing to the Donkey Kong tape in the camera bag) to verify his identity to the Guard.
Maintains innocence and composure despite the MacCreadys' denial and the Guard's suspicion.
Does not attempt to run away or panic when confronted by the Guard and the MacCreadys.
Shows emotional vulnerability by openly expressing his fear of being abandoned, which may undermine his perceived confidence.
Gives George a huge smile despite George's fury.
Rips Kim's backpack and grabs the walkie-talkie without waiting for explanation.
Runs to meet Kim and acts quickly to get the walkie-talkie to help the situation.

Smiles confidently at George despite tense situation, quickly takes walkie-talkie from Kim's backpack, and immediately looks for a way to dispose of the bomb, vaulting over the inspection stand and dashing for the exit.
Fails to anticipate George's violent reaction and is caught in a choke hold, used as a human shield.
Struggles to get free while holding up the walkie-talkie to warn about a bomb, attempting to communicate critical information under duress.
Is used as a human shield by George and unable to escape or effectively act beyond struggling.
Is kidnapped and held hostage on a plane, no direct action shown.
Emerges onto the boarding ramp with a gun, appearing desperate and pulling back inside when confronted.
Holds up the walkie-talkie to speak up despite being shoved away and told to be quiet.
Gives up arguing and moves to the back of the plane quietly when confronted aggressively.
Tries to figure out how to defuse the bomb, calls out for help without hesitation.
Hurries to the back of the airplane and attempts to disarm a bomb by opening the walkie-talkie and examining the wires.
Looks at the bomb wires in total bewilderment and calls out for help without knowing which wire to cut, showing panic and lack of knowledge.
Bites his lip worriedly, watches the bomb intently, shows fear and frustration, and cries tears of hopelessness.
Stares worriedly at the bomb, bites his lip, poised with a penknife but does not act decisively, shows visible fear and frustration, asks for help.
Expresses sorrow and regret aloud, nearly in tears, saying 'Oh, Jack, I'm sorry. I didn't mean to throw you away ---'
Close to tears, apologizes emotionally, appears overwhelmed and unable to maintain composure.
Rises reluctantly and hesitates when confronted with a bomb about to go off.
Responds quickly to Hal's urgent call and takes off down the aisle despite fear.
Struggles to free himself from George's grasp, attempting to escape despite danger.
Struggles to free himself from George's stronger grasp but fails.
Leaps to his feet and dashes toward the cockpit as soon as George loses grip.
Rushes into his father's arms and urgently warns about the bomb.
Bursts into the cockpit and quickly informs his father about the bomb and the time left before it explodes.
Glances at his watch to check the time remaining on the bomb, showing situational awareness and quick thinking.
Shoves his son through the small window to safety despite danger to himself.
Runs after the speeding plane trying to reach his father, showing concern and desperation.
Cries out for his father after the explosion, showing emotional vulnerability and sincere attachment.
Shoves his son through a small window despite difficulty, ensuring his son's escape.
Slips through the cockpit window and manages to hold on to the airplane wing despite the slipstream.
Leaps to his feet and runs after the accelerating plane, showing determination but ultimately unable to catch it.
Keeps running after the plane even as it quickly outdistances him, showing persistence but no effective impact.
Appears overwhelmed and shattered by the explosion, crying out for his father.
Cries openly and embraces his father tightly, showing genuine joy and relief.
Stares in disbelief and watches passively as the apparition approaches without taking any action.

Cries and is emotionally overwhelmed, relying on his father for comfort and support.
